scraper.wttj package¶

Submodules¶

scraper.wttj.WTTJOfferScraper module¶

class scraper.wttj.WTTJOfferScraper.WTTJOfferScraper(chrome, url_offer)¶

Bases: object

scrap_page()¶

It scrapes the page of a job offer from Welcom To The Jungle and returns a dataframe with the information extracted

Returns:

A dataframe with the information scraped from the job offer (url, location, degree, offer type, description, duration).

scraper.wttj.WTTJScraper module¶

class scraper.wttj.WTTJScraper.WTTJScraper(webdriver_path: str, nb_pages: int, output_name: str | None = None, min_delai: int = 5, max_delai: int = 7, update_every: int = 0, url_csv=None)¶

Bases: object

static initialisation_(webdriver_path)¶

It initialises a webdriver with the given path, and returns the webdriver

Parameters:

webdriver_path – The path to the webdriver executable file you want to use.

Returns:

the webdriver initialised with the executable..

launch_scraping()¶

Execute the scraping process. It first initialises the webdriver, then if a url_csv was mentionned, take this file and scrap the url, otherwise it gathers all the url by going from page to page until the number of pages is reached.

offers_links_(nb_pages)¶

It scrapes the links of the offers from the first page of the website, then it clicks on the next page button and scrapes the links of the offers from the second page, and so on…

Parameters:

nb_pages – the number of pages you want to scrape from Welcome To The Jungle

Returns:

A list of job offers urls

scrap_(links)¶

It scrapes the job offers contained in the list of links (links of job offers), and updates the dataframe if ‘update_every’ is different than 0.

Parameters:

links – list of links to scrap (basically job offers urls)
